events.name: Google I/O Extended Kampala Viewing Party on 17th, 18th and 20th of May 2017
events.description:
I/O Extended events bring local developer communities together to experience the I/O keynote and sessions with one another in real-time, around the globe. They may also offer unique activities such as hackathons, codelabs, and demos.

Join us at Outbox technology hub as we stream the event live on Wednesday 17th and 18th May 2017 from 6:00 pm to 9:00 pm. We shall host a codelab and speaker sessions for developers on 20th May 2017 from 9:00 am to enable developers apply the concepts learnt from the viewing party.

Please keep updated on our social media page for more updates.

I/O Extended events include a variety of options for developers from live streaming sessions to local demos, hackathons, codelabs, and more. These events are hosted in your neighborhood by local developer communities.

Register here to attend.
events.how_to_find_us: Level 4 Soliz House, Plot 23, Lumumba Avenue

events.name: Solving for NASA: Drones, machine learning & more...
events.description:
What do NASA, drones, and machine learning have in common? 

Join GDG Kampala community on 23rd June 2017 at Outbox and watch a recording of Google Developers Expert, Panayotis Tzinis, to find out.

This event will be accompanied by a discussion with a team from Innovex talking about drones and machine learning. 

About Panayotis Tzinis: 

Panayotis (aka Vader) is an Intelligence Tech lead of the X-Lab of Moonshot Lab, a tech-tank where crazy people, from scientists to artists, to developers to technologists, share their ideas in order to create moonshots (a radical solution, integrating breakthrough technology with native thinking). 

Panayotis is also a Google Developer Expert on Product Strategy and the lead of the GDG Thessaloniki as well as the promoter of GDGs in Greece. 

About His Talk:
Panayotis will share his experience working in his discomfort zone and how it helps him deliver breakthrough solutions with the hope of encouraging others to push their limits. 

The project he is going to share came out, almost, from a bet he made with George, an electrical & computer engineer focused on Space Environments, who he met at the NASA Space Apps challenge in his home town.

The Question was: How might we help astronauts not lose stuff in outer space?

In less than 2 weeks they organized a special NASA Design Sprint and gathered more than 20 people from different backgrounds to join and share their thoughts/experiences on how to "help" NASA solve this big challenge. The Sprint helped them to "space" out of their comfi-zone and see things from a different angles and perspectives, delivering what (at least they thought) was the best solution. 

"Without a doubt I can tell you that the Sprint and the team demystified my structured thinking and helped all of us create a common vision for approaching the challenge."

Register here.

events.name: Learn Concurrency Models in Python and Kotlin for Android Development
events.description:
Join us at Outbox on 25th July 2017 from 5:30 pm and listen to experienced developers in Web and Mobile Applications, from Andela and SafeBoda. Register here to attend [Free].

[Session 1]

Concurrency Models in Python

In sesson one, we shall look at Python Concurrency; Python approaches to concurrency, use cases that benefit from concurrency and common pitfalls.

Who will benefit?
This session will benefit Python developers and enthusiasts interested in ways to improve performance of backend applications.

Outcomes
Understand what options are available in Python to implement concurrency and in which cases to employ different options.

Pre-requisites
Python knowledge (intermediate or higher).

[Session 2]

Kotlin For Android Development

Kotlin is a statically typed programming language for the JVM, Android, the browser and *native.
Developed by Jetbrains, officially supported for Android Development and it’s 100%
interoperable with Java.

For Android developers, Kotlin support is a chance to use a modern and powerful language, helping solve common headaches such as runtime exceptions and source code verbosity. 

At the just ended Google I/O, the Android team announced first-class support for Kotlin

What shall we cover?
The talk covers the basics of Kotlin and using Kotlin for Android development.

Who will benefit?
Android developers with a desire to grow in Mobile software development will benefit from this session.

Outcomes?
The attendees will understand the basics of Kotlin programming language and how Kotlin makes Android app development less painful.

Pre - requisites
● Android development experience (beginner)
● Internet that can access https://goo.gl/Xzz9bM

Facilitators:

1) Aretha Kebirungi - A backend Software Engineer, whose languages of active development include Python, Java & Ruby. Her experience spans solutions development work in the banking sector, academic research and software companies.

2) Charles Muchene - An experienced Software Engineer with a demonstrated history of working in the consumer services industry. Skilled in Kotlin, Java, Android, PHP, Business Development, Embedded Systems, and Electrical Engineering. 

3) Kirk Agbenyegah - A Software developer at SafeBoda, Web and Mobile technology enthusiast who has worked with some software and web technology firms in developing successful products for the consumer market. 

Book your slot.

events.name: GDG DevFest Uganda 2017
events.description:
On the 30th of September 2017, GDG Uganda, a collaboration among seven(7) GDGs in the North, West and Central Uganda including GDG Kampala, GDG Makerere, GDG MUBS (Makerere University Business School), GDG UCU (Uganda Christian University), GDG SLAU (St. Lawrence University), GDG Gulu University and GDG Mbarara will bring together up to 400 techies, entrepreneurs, policy makers and industry players for the Annual DevFest event.

Register here to attend.

DevFest Uganda 2017 will have different activities from speaker sessions, Codelabs, speaker sessions, startup Fireside chats and a Hackathon.

GDG DevFest 2017 is aimed at equipping attendees with different skills (both technical and business) required for them to compete in the industry and also run successful companies.

We shall also present opportunities available for organisations, companies to improve their businesses and developers who are interested in using Google platforms to develop software.

Audience: 

Organisations, companies and institutions, Developers, Entrepreneurs, University students, Policy makers and Government. 

As part of the DevFest, we shall also host a Firebase AppFest bringing together 100 developers, where they will build an app in a day using Firebase and Cloud Functions. Join the AppFest.

events.name: AI & Machine Learning | System Architecture
events.description:
Join us at Outbox on Tuesday 31st October 2017 from 5:30 pm to 8:00 pm as we share ideas on the following topics. 

Session 1: 1 Hour 

Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning: Convolutional Neural networks for computer vision. 

We live in an interesting period when technology has finally evolved to solve algorithms that were initially published over 50 years ago – Artificial neural networks (ANNs). These are nature inspired algorithms greatly used in the field of artificial intelligence, more specifically a branch called deep learning. Deep learning is a technique used to develop applications considered intelligent covering a wide range including but not limited to:

Recommender systemsSpeech and writing pattern classification, Face recognition with computer vision, Control of high speed trainsStocks forecasting on financial markets, Anomaly detection on medical images, Control of electronic devices, washing machines, ovens etc.

What we shall cover? 

1) An intuitive overview of machine learning, neural networks and deep learning

2) Architecture of neural networks

3) Convolutional neural networks, what they are and how they work

4) How to build your own neural network

5) How we are using deep learning at the AI lab Makerere university

6) Other creative use-cases of deep learning 

Who should attend? 

 Developers/Researchers curious about artificial intelligence/machine learning/deep learning especially in the field of computer vision.

 A basic understanding of programming concepts is required, especially in python.

 Entrepreneurs/Business people willing to learn how machine learning can be used to improve marketing.

 Anyone curious about deep learning. 

Outcomes: 

At the end of this training, the black-box that is machine learning, neural networks and deep learning will hopefully be demystified, and you shall have a general intuitive understanding on how artificial intelligence works under the hood. 

Facilitator: 

Benjamin Akera; A Data scientist, software developer and research scholar at the Artificial Intelligence research lab, Makerere University, BSc. Software Engineering (MUK) enthusiastic about the applications of data science methods in the developing world. 

Session 2: 1 Hour 

System Architecture: System Architecture that serves at scale, a case for microservices 

System Architecture is one of the most over looked sections of software development. We shall look at best practices when building applications for scale. 

What shall we cover? 

Decoupling Mononolith Applications into Micro services top serve at scale. We shall make the case for Micro services architecture and how to go about building one for existing applications or applications starting from scratch. 

Who should attend? 

Software developers interested in building applications that will serve high traffic. 

Outcomes 

Best practices when designing applications that are resilient and scalable 

Facilitator Alex Nyika Omuyonga: A Senior Software Developer Laboremus Uganda Limited. Alex started his development career in Nairobi where he worked for a Fintech Company. He returned to Uganda to Work for MTN Uganda where he was part of teams that built high traffic applications that served MTN’s customers. Presently he is part of a team that builds and maintains fintech applications targeted for the Norwegian Market.

events.name: Artificial Intelligence Master Class with Facebook Developer Circles
events.description:
We present to you the AI Masterclass starting next Monday 6th November 2017 from 5:00 pm.

AI Masterclass is a series of 5 workshops (video screenings) and 3 live Q&A sessions about Artificial Intelligence brought to you by AI experts at Facebook.

Some of the topics to be covered include: 

Neural Networks, Speech Recognition, Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing, Recurrent Neural Networks.

We will also be hosting a couple of local AI experts, watch out for a panel discussion on the topic: Artificial Intelligence: How Is It Impacting Africa?

You don't need any previous experience in data science or AI to attend, although prior knowledge would definitely help.

events.name: The Basics of Android: Your First Step to Android Development
events.description:
What shall we do?
We shall cover the basics of Android, which marks your first step on your journey to becoming an Android developer.

Join us on 30th November 207 from 5:30 pm and learn how to do;
1) User Interfaces

i) Laptop
ii) Android Studio

This event is FREE to attend.

If you do not have Android Studio installed, please come at 5:00 pm and have it done before the session.

Who should attend?
This session is open to anyone who is interested in becoming an Android developer. Facilitator:
The session will be facilitated by Chrispinus Onyancha, an experienced Andriod developer, also Co-founder of Clinic Pesa.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam - Kampala
events.description:
• What we'll do
Learn the fundamentals of the Google Cloud Platform, how to run containers on it and how to use the platform for data engineering. Attendees get free access to the labs ($70+ value). No need to create a Google Cloud Platform account or register with a credit card.

How long does it take?
One in-person session of 3 hours, followed by 2-8 hours of self-study.

What is the end result?
Attendees will:
1) Learn how to set up development and production environments in the Cloud.
2) Learn how Docker and Kubernetes work, or learn how to process Big Data in the Cloud.
3) Get access to Qwiklabs.com, a Google training tool, free of charge (a $70+ value).
4) Get Google-hosted badges for your online profiles, to show potential employers what you know about Cloud Computing.

• What to bring
Laptop, pen and a notebook.

• Important to know
This event is FREE to attend.

events.description:

Learn the fundamentals of the Google Cloud Platform, how to run containers on it and how to use the platform for data engineering. Attendees get free access to the labs ($70+ value). No need to create a Google Cloud Platform account or register with a credit card.

How long does it take?
One in-person session of 3 hours, followed by 2-8 hours of self-study.

What is the end result?
Attendees will:
1) Learn how to set up development and production environments in the Cloud.
2) Learn how Docker and Kubernetes work, or learn how to process Big Data in the Cloud.
3) Get access to Qwiklabs.com, a Google training tool, free of charge (a $70+ value).
4) Get Google-hosted badges for your online profiles, to show potential employers what you know about Cloud Computing.

• What to bring

• Important to know
This event is FREE to attend.

events.name: Kotlin Meetup - Web Development with Kotlin
events.description:
Join us at Outbox on the 23rd of February 2018 from 5:00 pm to 8:00 pm and learn Web Development using Lotlin. Kotlin is a general purpose, open source, statically typed programming language for the JVM and Android that combines object-oriented and functional programming features.

What shall we cover? In this event we'll walk through developing a web application using spring boot, an overview of intellij idea integrated development environment and a couple of resources online to get you started with kotlin programming language to a professional kotlin programmer.

Kotlin works quite smoothly with Spring Boot and many of the steps found on the Spring Guides

Who should attend?

Anyone who would like to learn web development with Kotlin.

• What to bring
Laptop, pen and paper

• Important to know
The event is free to attend.

events.name: Hash Code 2018 by Google
events.description:
• What we'll do
We’ll be hosting a hub at Outbox for the Online Qualification Round of Hash Code, a team-based programming competition created by Google for university students and industry professionals. The Online Qualification Round takes place on 1st March at 8:30 PM EAT (18:30 CET) and registered teams from Kampala are invited to participate from our hub, which will take place on Soliz House, plot 23 Lumumba Avenue. Top scoring teams from the Online Qualification Round will then be invited to Google’s Dublin office to compete in the Final Round of the competition in April.

If you’re interested in joining our hub, find a team (two to four people) and be sure you all register at g.co/hashcode. Make sure to select Outbox from the list of hubs in the Judge System.

For any questions, please call Solomon on [masked].

• What to bring
Laptop, Pen and Paper.

• Important to know
This competition is open to Software Developers.

events.name: Mobile Site Certification Study Jam - Kampala
events.description:
• What we'll do
The Mobile Sites certification is a professional accreditation that Google offers to individuals who demonstrate proficiency in basic and advanced aspects of mobile website design and development. A Mobile Sites certification allows individuals to demonstrate that Google recognises them as an expert in mobile sites.

Any member of Google Partners can earn the Mobile Sites certification. The Mobile Sites certification allows you to demonstrate your expertise to current and prospective clients.

Benefits include:

1) Certificate: Show that you're a certified mobile sites professional with a personalised certificate that you can print.
2) Profile page: Share your expertise with a Google Partners public profile page that lists your certifications.

How the Mobile Sites certification works

When you sign up for Partners, you'll get access to our free Mobile Sites certification exam and related study materials.

Requirements

To become certified in Mobile Sites, you need to pass the Mobile Sites exam.

• What to bring
Laptop, pen and paper

• Important to know
Please read the details carefully. The Study Jam Certification if FREE to attend.

events.name: WTM Kampala: IWD Celebration 2018 - Building a New Horizon

Its FREE to attend.

events.name: An Introduction to Containers, their Orchestration with Kubernetes
events.description:
Introduction

Because of the benefits of containers, applications have been containerized recently.
Containers have magically changed the way we deploy and manage applications allowing us to build, develop, test, and even deploy applications on a single system with no upgrade downtimes.

What shall we cover?

This talk shall emphasize the different ways we can leverage Containers and Kubernetes to deploy and run robust applications.

We shall talk about how we can containerize and run applications on Kubernetes which is the missing layer that gives us the ability to manage many containers by providing features that enable containers to scale, talk to each other and work in harmony.

Who should attend?

Software developers, DevOps engineers and those who would like to learn about Cloud technologies.

Outcome:

By the end of the talk, participants shall understand containers and how to use them along with how to deploy containerized applications to kubernetes.

Speaker: Joannah Nangyekye

Joannah is a Software Engineering graduate who started her journey as a software engineering trainee at Laboremus Uganda after which she joined Fintech Uganda Limited as a programmer till June 2016 where she contributed to many banking applications during her position a programmer.

She has been developing software in C#, ruby and python. She has worked with ruby frameworks like Ruby on Rails and shoes and Python frameworks like django.

Please register here to attend (Free) https://goo.gl/zmxUKM

events.name: Kotlin Beyond Android - Using Kotlin on New and Existing Projects
events.description:
Learn to code in Kotlin in a very pragmatic way, while going through code examples. Join us on Friday 20th April at Outbox technology hub from 5:00 PM to 8:00 PM. We shall use app examples to practice and get comfortable using Kotlin in Android development. 1 hour to review the Kotlin fundamentals, and 1 hours to use Kotlin for Android development.

Outcome:
Upon completion of this workshop, you will know how to migrate your existing apps to Kotlin
and you will be able to use the power of Kotlin to write cleaner and more concise code in your
apps.

Who should attend?
This session is for Android developers who want to learn the Kotlin fundamentals and start
writing apps in Kotlin or migrating their existing apps to Kotlin.

Requirements:
A laptop with Intellij or Android studio installed. If you don’t have any you are required to come earlier before the session starts and you get them installed on your Laptop.

Speakers;
1) Kevin Janvier; An experienced Software developer currently working for a startup company in silicon valley
2) Bonnyface; Software developer at hackshade techs.

events.name: TensorFlow Dev Summit 2018 Extended Kampala
events.description:
TensorFlow is an open source software library for numerical computation using data flow graphs. Nodes in the graph represent mathematical operations, while the graph edges represent the multidimensional data arrays (tensors) communicated between them.

TensorFlow Dev Summit brings together a diverse mix of Machine Learning users from around the world for a full day of highly technical talks, demos, and conversation with the TensorFlow team and community.

Join GDG Kampala and the Google Cloud Developer Community (GCDC) Kampala on the 21st of April 2018 from 8:30 AM to 5:00 PM for a full day event with Keynote speeches and technical sessions.

What are the benefits?
1) Attendees will have the latest update and technology advancement about Machine Learning as well as getting up to date information about Tensor Flow.
2) Attendees who have not tried Machine Learning before can get their hands dirty with it. No software installation required.

Requirements:
Please carry a Laptop.

Who should attend?
All developers and enthusiasts interested in learning about Machine Learning are welcome for this event.

The TensorFlow Developer event is free to attend.

Do not forget to tweet using: #TFDevSummit #Extended @GCDCKampala @GDGKampala

events.name: Google I/O Keynote Viewing Party - With GDG & Andela
events.description:
• What we'll do
I/O brings together developers from around the globe for talks, hands-on learning with Google experts, and a first look at Google’s latest developer products.

This year’s developer festival will be held May 8-10 at the Shoreline Amphitheatre in Mountain View, CA. GDG Uganda and Andela will host an Extended Keynote viewing party on Tuesday 8th May 2018 from 6:00 pm - 10:00 pm. Drinks and snacks will be served.

Join us at Andela offices located on Bukoto Street (4th floor) and see what opportunities you can have with Google platforms. From Keynote speeches to codelabs, as we introduce you to Google technologies.

Software developers, engineers, entrepreneurs and tech enthusiasts are all welcome to the Google I/O event.

Please reserve your slot on this meetup website.

• What to bring
A pen and a Notebook

• Important to know
This event is FREE to attend for all developers and enthusiasts.

events.name: Kotlin Meetup June 2018: Multiplatform Projects with Kotlin
events.description:
Join us at Outbox on Friday 1st of June 2018 as we learn how to setup and build a multiplatform project with Kotlin. Also learn about the latest about Kotlin released at Google I/O 2018.

What shall we cover?

1) Android Things and Kotlin - Brian

In this talk, Brian tells us about the latest and greatest about Kotlin released at Google I/O 2018 and about the development of Sentinel, the first home security robot powered by Android Things, and how hardware, software, coded in Kotlin, Firebase and how the Google Cloud Platform integrates with Sentinel to "bring it to life".

2) Kotlin Multiplatform Projects - Johnstone

A Kotlin multiplatform project allows you share code between different platforms. It takes a different approach to cross platform development than Xamarin and other frameworks. This talk will be about how to setup and build a multiplatform project. We will look at features of Kotlin multiplatform development through an example project. We will also look at the current limitations.

Speaker Bios:

Johnstone is an Android Engineer and a Kotlin advocate. Prior to building Android apps, he was a Backend Engineer. He was an early adopter of Kotlin and absolutely loves the language. He is currently a software engineer at Safeboda.

This event is FREE to attend for all developers and enthusiasts.

Please fill out this form https://goo.gl/BhR3rV to give your details after reserving your slot here.

events.name: Google I/O Extended 2018 Kampala - Design Session & Mini Hackathon
events.description:
I/O brings together developers from around the globe for talks, hands-on learning with Google experts, and a first look at Google’s latest developer products.

GDG Kampala will host follow-up sessions from the Google developer festival, Google I/O, with focus on Flutter Framework (7th June), a Design Session 8th June) and a Mini-Hackathon (9th June) for Kampala on 7th & 8th June (5:30 pm - 8:30 pm) and 9th June (8:30 am - 7:00 pm) respectively for the developer community.

Flutter is Google's mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code and its open source.

Team up and create your own product. During the design session on 8th, we shall form teams and come up with ideas through a design challenge. Coding begins on Saturday and you are free to use any programming language.

Software developers, engineers, entrepreneurs and tech enthusiasts are all welcome to the Google I/O event.

Please register here to participate https://goo.gl/gL48KM after reserving your slot on this meetup website.

events.name: Kotlin Uganda July Meetup: Kotlin's Multi-Platform Projects
events.description:
Join us at Outbox Hub this Friday 6th July 2018 for the July Edition of Kotlin Meetup from 5:30 pm to 8:00 pm.

What shall we cover?

In this talk, Seremba John will cover the principle of "Write once, target many" using Kotlin's multi-platform projects.

1) Setting up a new multi-platform project,
2) How to write a common business logic in a platform agnostic way,
3) Compiling a common code for target platforms, and how to include it in a platform-specific way.

In addition, we will review a full multi-platform example app by JetBrains. This example will depict the power of sharing code between Android, JVM Backend, and iOS.

What to bring:

Attendees who wish to follow along in the demo should bring a laptop with any Kotlin supporting IDE of their choice.

Speakers:
1) Charles muchene - Software Engineer at Safeboda.
2) Seremba John - Software developer at Andela Uganda.

events.name: Kampala Kotlin Weekend of Coding
events.description:
Announcing the first Kotlin Weekend of Coding!

Looking forward to discover a language that will support you in writing readable and understandable code in few lines?

Without any help of any extra libraries such as Lombok, Guava and even more, Kotlin will challenge you to write code that even the business analyst should be able to understand. With Kotlin you can finally focus on the business features you want to implement instead working on the language itself.

Join us at Outbox on 4th August 2018 for the first Kotlin Weekend of Coding. In this workshop, you will build a simple webservice in Kotlin and hopefully see how easy it can be to write new business functionality.

If you are an Android or Website developer and want to develop apps with Kotlin this workshop will be perfect for you,this workshop is a two day event and its a payed for event and tickets are at UGX 20,000 which facilitates your meals and a Kotlin Tshirt,We have yet another cool meetup planned. This time you actually get to code yourself. In Kotlin!

Using Android Studio we will build a full Android Application using Kotlin.

What shall we cover?

Kotlin in Android (Its strength)
Using the Architecture Components library (ViewModel with retrofit)
Connect our application to the internet and download Mars Rover's photo of the day
Agenda:

9:00 am - 9:30 am: Registration
9:30 am - 9:45 am: - Using Intellij we will cover:
- Kotlin syntax (Another programming language like Java required)
- Using filters
- Kotlin treats (What makes Kotlin great)
9:45 am - 10:00 am: Break
10:00 am - 01:00 pm: Android using Kotlin
01:00 pm - 01:45 pm : Lunch
01:45 pm - 03:00 pm: how to integrate Kotlin with Spring
03:00 pm - 05:00 pm: Deep-dive section starts - Using Kotlin in Projects

Get your tickets using the numbers below or go to Outbox hub;

Airtel money: [masked]
MTN mobile money: [masked]

Instructors and Mentors:

1) Sseremba john; Software developer at Andela with over 5 years of experince

2) Walusimbi Alex; Software developer at innovation nest bringing a vast experience in mobile development

3) Jest Boniface; Software developer at HackshadeTechs with over 4 years of experience in the field of mobile application Development.

4) Nicodemus Ojwee; Software developer at Toll and Haben in German bringing with a vast experience in the modern software development Using Kotlin.

5) Edwin Kato; Android Engineer and a Kotlin advocate. Prior to building Android apps, he was a Backend Engineer. He was an early adopter of Kotlin and absolutely loves the language. He is currently a software engineer at Andela Uganda

What to Bring:

A laptop with Android studio installed and intellij (you can install on arrival).

- JDK 6+ installed

- An IDE with the Kotlin plugin. IntelliJ IDEA is recommended (the community edition is free) comes with the plugin installed.

Please register here https://goo.gl/1o7qwa

events.name: Next Extended '18 Kampala
events.description:
Next Extended events bring together developer communities around the world to experience talks, in-depth product demos and behind-the-scenes interviews.

Get hold of the Next ‘18 experience. Join GCDC Kampala and GDG Kampala on the 7th and 9th of August for the Keynote sessions.

Hear from Google Cloud leaders about how the cloud is transforming business, making Artificial Intelligence available to everyone, and improving the lives and circumstances of people around the world in ways never before possible.

See what's new at Google Cloud. A lot, from new enterprise capabilities, to new ways of building apps that link people and data, to harnessing the natural symbiosis of IoT, Big Data and AI to do more, know more, and achieve more.

We shall also have a Machine Learning and Kubernetes beginner study.

Content for the ML learning study include 2 Labs:
1) Cloud ML Engine: Qwik Start
2) Cloud Natural Language API

There after we shall have a beginner course on Kubernetes.

Who should attend?
Anyone who is interested in learning about Kubernetes, Machine Learning and AI.

Prerequisite:
To be part of the study, you need to come with a laptop and also writing material for your notes.

No prior knowledge is required and participation is FREE!

events.name: Flutter Study Jam - Kampala
events.description:
Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Want to get started on building Flutter apps?

Join GDG Kampala for a 3 day Flutter Study Jam (30th Aug, 4th Sep and 6th Sep 2018) from 6:00 pm to 9:00 pm. Together we'll work through Flutter Udacity Course prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals.

Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers.

Requirements:
The laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine. Check out: https://flutter.io/get-started/install/

events.name: Flutter Study Jam Kampala - Day 2
events.description:
Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Want to get started on building Flutter apps?

Join GDG Kampala for day 2/3 of Flutter Study Jam on 4th Sep 2018 from 5:30 pm to 8:30 pm. Together we'll work through the second part of Flutter Udacity Course. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals.

Attending for the first time?
Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers.

Requirements:
The laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine. Check out: https://flutter.io/get-started/install/

events.name: Flutter Study Jam Kampala - Day 3
events.description:
Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Want to get started on building Flutter apps?

Join GDG Kampala for day 3/3 of Flutter Study Jam on 6th Sep 2018 from 5:30 pm to 8:30 pm. Together we'll work through the second part of Flutter Udacity Course. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals.

Attending for the first time?
Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers.

Requirements:
The laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine. Check out: https://flutter.io/get-started/install/

events.name: Kotlin User Meetup September 2018 Edition: Kotlin JS
events.description:
Kotlin on the Server, Kotlin on Android, Kotlin on the browser!

Did you know that since version 1.1, the Kotlin compiler has offered a production-grade Kotlin-to-JavaScript transpiler?

Using Kotlin/JS, we can not only use Kotlin for interacting with DOM elements, but can also use Kotlin to communicate with server-side JavaScript such as Node.js!

Join us on Friday 28th September 2018 for the September Edition of Kotlin Meetup from 5:30 pm.

What shall we cover?

In this month's meetup, we'll poke around the Kotlin transpiler and examine the javascript code that gets produced. We will go through several small projects to get a better understanding as to why you might choose Kotlin instead TypeScript or JavaScript for your application.

Facilitator:
Nicodemus Ojwee a software developer at Toll and Haben a company in German.

events.name: Building a Cross Platform App using Flutter
events.description:
Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Flutter's hot reload helps you quickly and easily experiment, build UIs, add features, and fix bugs faster. Experience sub-second reload times, without losing state, on emulators, simulators, and hardware for iOS and Android.

Join us on Friday 2nd November at Outbox from 5:30 pm as we walk through Building a cross platform App using Flutter.

What shall we cover?

1) How to compose Flutter widgets for building nice UI apps for Android and iOS.
2) We will try to develop a simple real estate app that lists houses and their characteristics like prices, location, size, etc.

At the end of this talk you will get a broad idea of Flutter core principles like composition, reactivity and event-driven programming.

Presenter: Eddy W M (Eddy Wanny Mugisho)

Join us on slack

events.name: GDG Kampala DevFest 2018
events.description:
GDG DevFests are community-run events that can offer speaker sessions across multiple product areas, hack-a-thons, codelabs, and more.

This year GDG Kampala together with Developer Student Clubs (DSC) will bring to you the Largest DevFest in Uganda alongside other developer communities and Industry players. The theme for this year is "Build for Digital Wellbeing."

Join us on 1st December from 8:30 pm to 4:30 pm at Outbox and experience speaker sessions and codelabs while networking for great opportunities.

We shall cover topics that shape technology today including AI and Cloud, Web and Android technologies.

Who should attend?

1) Software Developers and Engineers
2) DevOps Engineers
3) Tech Enthusiasts

Requirements:
i) Those who would like to get their hands dirty with code are advised to carry a laptop.
ii) It is advisable to come with a team if you would want to participate in a hackathon.

Please fill the form linked https://goo.gl/w5PBYQ to give your details and expectations (Highly recommended).

Video:
Listen to GDG Leads share why they are excited about DevFest season here: https://goo.gl/DibwwZ

Find agenda here: https://goo.gl/1aDJY1

events.name: Deep Dive into Firebase Platform - GDG Kampala DevFest 2018
events.description:
As part of the DevFest Kampala Event on 1st December 2018, we shall host a Firebase session, introducing interested participants to the concept with a codelab for those who would like to have their hands dirty.

Firebase is a backend platform for building Web, Android and IOS applications which offers real time database, different APIs, multiple authentication types and hosting platform.

In this session, we shall cover the basics of the Firebase platform and explains how to deal with its various components and sub-components.

See details of the main DevFest event here https://goo.gl/QUTFSX

events.name: What the Future Holds for Flutter - Viewing Party
events.description:
So far we have had a series of events introducing Flutter to the community. Now we’re holding a global party for Flutter, and we’d love you to be part of the celebration!

Join us on Tuesday 4th December at Outbox from 6:30 to 9:30 pm for the viewing party and a talk. A codelabe in followup session. We’re hosting Flutter Live where we’ll share a variety of news and updates about Flutter.

Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Flutter's hot reload helps you quickly and easily experiment, build UIs, add features, and fix bugs faster. Experience sub-second reload times, without losing state, on emulators, simulators, and hardware for iOS and Android.

Watch the introduction Video: https://goo.gl/pHxTUf

Find more on Flutter at DevFest 2018 Kampala: https://goo.gl/GHZcrs

Join our slack channel here: https://goo.gl/e98HHq

events.name: Kotlin Conference Uganda 2018
events.description:
Kotlin Night Uganda is a half-day conference that includes two streams with talks on Kotlin or related technologies, supported by JetBrains.

Join us on Saturday 8th December from 9:00 AM for great talks with experienced Developers.

Who should attend?
1) Kotlin and Java/Android developers,
2) Everyone who would like to deep dive into Kotlin.

What shall we cover?
- Kotlin Language
- Kotlin and Android
- Web development with Kotlin: Frontend, Spring framework, ...
- Coroutines
- Java and Kotlin interoperability and migration
- Future of Kotlin

• Why Kotlin?
- Google is adding Kotlin as an official programming language for Android development
- Kotlin projects, in general, require 15–20% less code than Java (Basecamp)
- Teams that have migrated projects from Java to Kotlin have reported up to 30% fewer defects post-migration (Pinterest)

Register here: https://goo.gl/QukMis Fee: UGX 10,000 only.

events.name: Build Actions For Your Community - Google Assistant Session 1/2
events.description:
Build Actions For Your Community is a developer event that has been organized to let you learn how to build Actions for the Google Assistant that are useful for your community - whether it's a professional network, interest group, or your hometown.

Here is a short video to learn about Google Assistant: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FPfQMVf4vwQ

NB:

Kindly confirm your participation by registration on this link as well: http://bit.ly/GDGKlaForm

events.name: Kotlin Meetup - Building Web Applications Using Kotlin JS
events.description:
Intro to Web Dev with Kotlin - Kevin Janvier

Kevin is an Android Developer at Cellulant. He is passionate about Kotlin and leveraging it to build functional and reactive apps.

With front-end web apps becoming larger and more complex, and Node.js allowing Javascript to be used on the server side, the language has had a rapid rise in popularity. But for many JVM/Android developers, the thought of getting into front end web development and the Javascript ecosystem can seem quite unpleasant. However with Kotlin's ability to target JS, we can leverage the language features we've come to love, to make the experience a bit more fun.

In this talk, we'll explore how we can build a Kotlin front-end application and even use Kotlin to interact with Node.js on the server.

RSV:

Reserve your Ticket for this event for free using this link:

https://buildingwebappwithkotlinjs.splashthat.com

events.name: Cloud Study Jam - GCP Essentials
events.description:
Study Jams are back! Join us on the 9th March at Makerere Innovation & Incubation Center (MIIC), Level 5, Block B, CoCIS Building, Makerere University for our Google Cloud Study Jam where we'll be taking on:
- Hands-on practice with the Google Cloud Platform’s fundamental tools and services.
- Learning how to set up development and production environments in the Cloud.
- Learning how Docker and Kubernetes work, or learn how to process Big Data in the Cloud.

And at the end of the day you will:
-Get access to Qwiklabs, a Google training tool, free of charge
-Get Google-hosted badges for your online profile, to show potential employers what you know about Cloud computing.

What to bring
-Notebook, Laptop.

Note:
- This Study Jam has limited slots. Priority will given to people who will confirm availability a week prior to the Study Jam.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam - IoT in the Google Cloud
events.description:
In this quest, you will learn about Google Cloud’s IoT Core service and its integration with other services like GCS, Dataprep, Stackdriver and Firestore. The labs in this quest use simulator code to mimic IOT devices and the learning here should empower you to implement the same streaming pipeline with real world IoT devices.

And at the end of the day you will:
-Get access to Qwiklabs, a Google training tool free of charge
-Get Google-hosted badges for your online profile, to show potential employers what you know about IoT with Google Cloud.

What to bring
-Notebook, Laptop.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam - Machine Learning
events.description:
Our Study Jams continues. Join us on 30th March at Makerere Innovation & Incubation Center (MIIC), Level 5, Block B, CoCIS Building, Makerere University.

Big data, machine learning, and artificial intelligence are today’s hot computing topics, but these fields are quite specialized and introductory material is hard to come by. Fortunately, GCP provides user-friendly services in these areas and Qwiklabs has you covered with this introductory-level quest, so you can take your first steps with tools like Big Query, Cloud Speech API, and Cloud ML Engine.

And at the end of the day you will:
-Get access to Qwiklabs, a Google training tool free of charge
-Get Google-hosted badges for your online profile, to show potential employers what you know about Machine Learning.

What to bring
-Notebook, Laptop.

events.name: IWD Celebrations Kampala
events.description:
Join us in celebrating and shining a spotlight on women that have impacted the tech community in Kampala and are breaking barriers for women in tech.

The IWD Celebration will be held on 6th April 2019 from 9:00 AM to 4:00 PM at the Outbox Hub.

You can look forward to a full day of talks, inspirational testimonies and code labs, all led by awesome women in the community today.

This event focuses on Women but is not a Women only event.

Agenda:

9:00 AM - Arrival & Registration
9:30 AM - Welcome and Opening Remarks
9:35 AM - Keynote
10:20 AM - Workshop Track 1: IamRemarkable
11:00 AM - Breakfast
11:40 AM - Workshop Track 2: PWA
12:30 AM - Lunch and networking
2:00 AM - Workshop Track 3: Positioning yourself in the marketplace
2:45 PM - Panel Discussion
3:30 PM - Announcements and Closing remarks
3:45 PM - Networking and Departure

events.name: Google I/O 2019 Extended Kampala Viewing Party
events.description:
Join Thousands of developers around the world as we watch the annual Google I/O live from San Francisco and discuss what this means for the local community.

From Keynote speeches to Codelabs, join us as we discuss the Opportunities the Google Technologies and Platform has to offer for the local community.

This event is Free. However, reserve your slot through this meetup website and also register your details using this form: http://bit.ly/GDGKlaForm

events.name: Kotlin Multi-platform Meetup
events.description:
Join Kotlin Uganda user group this Friday, 10th May discussing the topic- multi-platform development in Kotlin.

Often, mobile teams find themselves siloed and solving the same solution two or three times across platforms. Cross-platform frameworks and solutions have been developed to mitigate this issue, but many of those have been abandoned or not widely adopted by the community.

In this talk learn how native Kotlin can offer you and your team a multi-platform approach and why it may help solve the issue from a different approach.

This talk will discuss what multi-platform and native Kotlin is, how organizations and teams can utilize it in their projects, and the advantages and disadvantages of adopting it.

Speakers:
Smile Egabi -Principal Software Engineer at SafeBoda with 6 years Android experience and over 10 years professional development experience. Smile is from Nigeria

Nicodemus Ojwee - software developer at Toll & haben with four years experience in mobile app development.

Register to attend here: https://kotlinmultiplartform.splashthat.com

upcoming.name: Kotlin/Everywhere Kampala Event
upcoming.description:
Want to get started with Kotlin, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Kotlin/Everywhere event.

Kotlin/Everywhere is a series of community-led events, in collaboration with JetBrains and Google, where you can learn the essentials and best practices of Kotlin in Android, Google Cloud Platform, and multi-platform development. Kotlin/Everywhere 2019 in ‘Kampala’ Uganda will be held by the Kotlin uganda user group developer

Our speakers will be giving talks about the usage of Kotlin/Everywhere: on Android, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), multi-platform, and more. In addition to that - you can get hands-on experience with Kotlin from the multiple CodeLabs held at the event.

Here is the lineup of the speakers:
+ Mutebi Brian - Keynote speaker
+ Ojok Ivan - Software Developer, Innovation Nest
+ Chelimo Mercy - Kotlin Native, Software Developer, Innovation Nest
+ Nicodemus Ojwee - KotlinJS, Software Developer, Toll and Haben, Germany
+ Rita Nabukalu - Modern Android Development with Kotlin - Software Developer, Innovation Nest
+ Kevin Janvier - Kotlin on Android, Senior Implementation Engineer, Cellulant Nairobi
+ Smile Egbai - Kotlin Multiplatform, Software Engineer, SafeBoda
+ Yasin Kimbowa - Kotlin Architecture, Software Developer, Innovation Nest

What to bring to the event:
+ Laptop — Mac, PC, Chromebook, Linux, everyone's welcome.
+ Laptop charger.
+ The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, use Firefox or Chrome.

Looking forward to seeing you at the event!
